DataAnalysisHelper¶

DataAnalysisHelper.perform_analysis(data_df, x_df, y_df, clustered_data, prop, show_contour_clustered=True, show_contour_raw=True, show_bar=True, cluster_name='', cluster_iter=0, save_clustered_contour=False, save_dir='', give_cluster_report=False, print_to_console=False, print_to_text_file=False, text_file_name='', clusters_save_dir='/ClusterPlots', cluster_histogram_dir='/ClusterInfoHistograms', save_cluster_histograms=False, save_clustered_data=False, clustered_data_dir='/ClusteredData')¶
Parameters

  • data_df – The original data we are clustering off of

  • x_df – The x values of the dataset

  • y_df – The y values of the dataset

  • clustered_data – The clustered data from the original dataset

  • prop – The property we are showing off, something like Hardness for example

  • show_contour_clustered – A boolean of whether or not to show the contour plots

  • show_contour_raw – A boolean of whether or not to show the contour plots

  • show_bar – A boolean of whether or not to show the bar graphs

  • cluster_name – The name of the cluster

  • cluster_iter – The iteration of the cluster

  • save_clustered_contour – A boolean of whether or not to save the clustered contour plot

  • save_dir – The directory to save the figures to ######### Deprecated #########

  • give_cluster_report – A boolean of whether or not to print out a report of the clusters’ details

  • print_to_console – A boolean of whether or not to print out information to the console

  • print_to_text_file – A boolean of whether or not to print out information to a text file

  • text_file_name – The file path to save the text file to

  • clusters_save_dir – The directory to save the contour plots to

  • cluster_histogram_dir – The directory to save the histograms which highlight cluster fractions to

  • save_cluster_histograms – A boolean of whether or not to save the clustered data’s histogram representation

  • save_clustered_data – A boolean of whether or not to save the clustered data

  • clustered_data_dir – The directory to store the clustered data inside of

Returns

Nothing at the moment

Performs the data analysis associated with the given data and clustered results.

DataAnalysisHelper.plot_clustered_data(x_df, y_df, clustered_data, prop, cluster_name, cluster_iter, save_clustered_contour, save_dir, show_contour_clustered=False, clusters_save_dir='/ClusterPlots')¶
Parameters

  • x_df – The x values of the data

  • y_df – The y values of the data

  • clustered_data – The clustered result of the data

  • prop – The property we are clustering on

  • cluster_name – The name of the cluster

  • cluster_iter – The iteration of the cluster

  • save_clustered_contour – A boolean of whether or not to save the clustered contour plot

  • save_dir – The directory to save the figures to ####### DEPRECATED ######

  • show_contour_clustered – Whether or not to show the contour plot

  • clusters_save_dir – The directory to save the contour plots to

Returns

Nothing at the moment

DataAnalysisHelper.plot_clusters_fractions(cluster_results, prop, show_bar=False, save_cluster_histograms=False, cluster_histogram_dir='', cluster_name='', cluster_iter=0)¶
Parameters

  • cluster_results – The results of a clustering algorithm, storing the clustered data inside of a DataFrame

  • prop – The property we are clustering

  • show_bar – A boolean of whether to show the bar graph or not

  • save_cluster_histograms – A boolean of whether to save the bar graph or not

  • cluster_histogram_dir – A directory to save the file to if we are saving it

  • cluster_name – The name of the clustering configuration we are using

  • cluster_iter – The iteration of the clustering configuration we are using

Returns

Nothing

Plots the fraction of data inside of each cluster in the cluster_results DataFrame

DataAnalysisHelper.plot_raw_data(data_df, x_df, y_df, prop)¶
Parameters

  • data_df – The DataFrame of data we are clustering

  • x_df – The x values of the data

  • y_df – The y values of the data

  • prop – The property we are actually clustering

Returns

Nothing at the moment

Plots the raw data we read in as a contour plot

DataAnalysisHelper.print_cluster_details(data_df, clustered_data_df, cluster_name, print_to_console=False, print_to_text_file=False, text_file_name='')¶
Parameters

  • data_df – A DataFrame representation of all of the raw data we are reading

  • clustered_data_df – A DataFrame representation of all of the clustered data we are reading

  • cluster_name – The name of the clustering configuration we are running

  • print_to_console – A boolean of whether or not to print out information to the console

  • print_to_text_file – A boolean of whether or not to print out information to a text file

  • text_file_name – The file path to save the text file to

Returns

Nothing

Print the mean, fractions, and standard deviations of each cluster Mean - Mean value of all elements in a cluster Standard Deviation - Standard deviation of all elements in a cluster Fraction - The fraction of the whole data set which is in this cluster

DataAnalysisHelper.save_data(clustered_data, clustered_data_dir, cluster_name='', cluster_iteration=0)¶
Parameters

  • clustered_data – The clustered data DataFrame we are saving

  • clustered_data_dir – The directory we are saving the clustered data to

  • cluster_name – The name of the clustering configuration we are running

  • cluster_iteration – The iteration of the current clustering configuration

Returns

Nothing

A helper method that is used for saving the data to a certain directory in a .xlsx file
